_inspectorSnowReport.Report:
12/16 OPS UPDATE: Hi all, a quick word on the worsened condition of Highway 410 at Boise Creek: we are working closely with WSDOT but at this time have not been given any repair timeframe estimate or other information on workaround possibilities, as they continue to juggle multiple projects across the state after last week's historic flooding. We will continue to remain closed through at least Thursday 12/18, but, while chances are very slim, we are holding on to some hope for this coming weekend. Stay tuned for further updates on operations come tomorrow, hopefully alongside more info from WSDOT.

As of now, 410 remains closed, with limited access for vital services and local residents only. Please refer to WSDOT resources and the Enumclaw Police Dept page for more information on vital access. 

This week's forecast shows decent snowfall accumulations into the weekend, so, finally, snowpack may no longer a barrier to operations. Stay tuned to the mountain report for updates on this. 

Big thanks to the Greenwater Fire Department, our Crystal Mountain team members, and the entire Crystal Community for your continued support as we ride out this rough start. We have a long winter season of powder days, sunshine and good times at the mountain ahead.

  • Parking reservations for days we are officially closed will be automatically canceled with no penalties, and any payments will be refunded.
  • Day tickets and rentals purchased in advance on days we are officially closed can be deferred to a different day with applicable price adjustments by emailing gservice@skicrystal.com or giving us a call daily from 9:00 a.m. - 5:00 p.m. at 833-279-7895, or will otherwise be automatically refunded after 2pm before the day of your booking. 
  • Ski and Ride School + Freeride programs and single days, keep an eye out for further communications through email on re-bookings and refunds.
  • Intro to Backcountry courses are cancelled for this week. Keep an eye out for an email regarding rebooking and refunds. 
  • Webcams: some remain offline due to internet outages on the mountain. 
  • Season to date snowfall + Base Depths reported as of  12/10. Overnight and 24 hour totals will be updated regularly upon season start. 
ADVANCED PARKING RESERVATIONS FOR THE SEASON ARE OPEN. BOOK YOURS HERE.
Shuttle Reservations on are open for 7 day window bookings. Reminder-  reservation cancellations are now required this year.  
 
REX 2.0: Stay tuned with our social media and blog for imagery and updates!
Crystal Mountain Instagram | Crystal Mountain Facebook | Crystal Mountain Blog

PRE-SEASON UPHILL TRAVEL INFO: Uphill travel may be restricted at any time before and during the season for avalanche mitigation or other safety concerns. Uphill travelers must confirm that the "No Uphill Travel lights" are off. These are located at: The bottom station of the Gondola, Bottom lift shack of Discovery lift the bottom lift shack of Chinook Express lift and the top of Quicksilver.
  • Slopes are not avalanche-controlled. Ski and ride at your own risk.
  • Be aware of heavy equipment across the mountain. Be sure you are visible and give ample space to moving vehicles.
  • In case of incident, Ski Patrol may not be available to help. Rescue, if possible, will be delayed and may cost you. Come prepared and self-sufficient.
 An Uphill Travel pass is required during the regular season and can be obtained at no cost at Guest Services. For complete information see our Uphill Travel Page.  


HIRING FOR THE 25/26 SEASON

Did you know we're hiring for the 25/26 season? Come work and play at Washingtons premier ski destination! Rooted in community, the Crystal Crew is unbeatable. Check out our positions on our website today.

25/26 WINTER PRODUCTS & PASSES

  • NIGHT SKIING HAS BEEN EXTENDED FOR THE 25/26 SEASON! FROM 28 to 53 NIGHTS! Read full announcement 
  • Daily lift tickets are now on sale, plus $62 Tuesday's are NOW DOUBLED! Every 2nd and now 4th Tuesday of the 25/26 season, ride for only $62! Lock in your holiday plans, or your next trip with savings you can't beat. Purchase now and save later.
  • Performance Ski, Snowboard and Beginner Rental Pass: ON SALE NOW! 
  • Tune Pass: Premier and Base available for purchase!
  • Demo Pass: Lock in the best gear of the 25/26 season with unlimited use!
  • 25/26 3-Day Midweek & Anytime Passes: Your pass to the perfect powder day, groomer day or when conditions are right for you. Purchase today and gear up for a rad winter.
  • Afternoon Pass: With extended night skiing dates, take your Afternoon Pass to the next level!

25/26 WINTER PROGRAMS,CLINICS, AND NECESSITIES

  • Ski and Ride School: Explore our programs and find your right fit.
  • Freeride Program (NEW! Adult Programs now available): Registration now open, limited spots available! 
  • AIARE Course & Certification: Ski the backcountry with expert knowledge and certification
  • Seasonal Gear storage: Hassle-free on mountain storage with limited availability, lock your space in today!
  • Seasonal Lockers: For you or the entire family, check out options today .
  • A-Lot Permits:  Lock in your A-Lot permit today, limited availability.
    Full Day Seasonal Lesson Programs for 4-6 year olds are now available- with lunch included too!   
  • Secure your spot. Already signed up for a 2-hour session and want to upgrade? No problemjust call us at 833-279-7895

In case of on-mountain emergency: Call 360-663-3064 or 911
